The following is rated "S" for

VOICE (CONT'D)
In a world where movies have been

The show so powerful you binge

watch it on Netflix... So all-

friends even if they don't watch
TV... and so addicting you can't

Journey to scenic New Mexico, because

to film in than Los Angeles.

VOICE (CONT'D)
And meet chemistry teacher Walter

White. He's got the kind of cancer
that makes you cough. A lot.

VOICE (CONT'D)
He'll cook crystal meth to pay for

his expensive cancer treatment...
then to save money for his

VOICE (CONT'D)
Meet his partner Jesse Pinkman, a

Juggalo without the makeup who
prefers the formal term for female dog.

VOICE (CONT'D)
Together, they'll battle some of

VOICE (CONT'D)
All of which happen to be angry

VOICE (CONT'D)
But that's not all, Walt's also got

There's his annoying wife Skyler...

who at first you wish would just go
away.

VOICE (CONT'D)
Then later will wish she could just

get away, since she's married to a
complete sociopath

VOICE (CONT'D)
There's also a baby who shows up

VOICE (CONT'D)
A son who...we're not sure if we're allowed

VOICE (CONT'D)
And a brother-in-law cop who's

terrible at telling jokes...and
even worse at recognizing that his

own family is running a crystal
meth empire.

VOICE (CONT'D)
Prepare for five epic seasons

VOICE (CONT'D)
Aw man that was awesome right

Oh man that was so good!

VOICE (CONT'D)
But you'll also have to sit through

VOICE (CONT'D)
Yeah I guess that did take a long time to pay off

But that made it totally worth it!

Get ready for a show where anyone

can be killed at any time, and in
any way...

VOICE (CONT'D)
and the world's greatest Price is

VOICE (CONT'D)

comments.author: ProgramThis!

comments.text:
All 5 seasons in one week...Yeah this show is definitely addicting and 
sends a lot of messages. I particularly liked the scene where Walter was 
alone in the desert, after essentially killing his brother in law, with 11 
million dollars in a barrel. All those money and yet he was pitiful and 
alone and his family that he claimed over and over that he wanted to help, 
hated him so much they wanted absolutely nothing to do with him. Really a 
great show and it's funny how you go from rooting for Walter to questioning 
him and in the end hating him and getting sort of depressed from how he 
ends up.﻿

comments.author: Camila Spagnuolo

comments.text:
Check this out: Walter White uses the name Heisenberg as an alias. Werner 
Heisenberg was a physicist who came up with the Uncertainty Principle. The 
Uncertainty Principle is regarded as a theoretical obstacle in the pursuit 
of achieving the transportation of matter, or teleportation. There is also 
something known as The Matrix Interpretation of the Uncertainty Principle. 
In the film The Matrix, they use telephones to transport themselves between 
the matrix and "the real world". In both Dr. Who and Bill and Ted's 
Excellent Adventure, they also use telephones as a mode of transportation 
through time and space. In Breaking Bad, there's a scene where Walter White 
comes out of nowhere to flatten the two drug dealers that Jesse intends to 
shoot. Mr. Garrison from South Park looks like Walter White. In one 
episode, Mr. Garrison invents a new mode of transportation which is 
a circular, and requires the user to engage in homosexual activity in order 
to use it (exclusivity). He states that his mode of transportation has the 
benefit of not needing to "go to the stupid fart-faced airport". The word 
"airport" in this case is most likely a euphemism for sites such as Menwith 
Hill near my home town of Ilkley. There is a video right here on the 
YouTubes of a man in China riding across a junction on a moped, with a 
truck coming the other way. Just before the truck hits the man, he vanishes 
into thin air, leaving the truck driver to get out and look in confusion. 
When the footage is slowed down, there is a freeze-frame of the moment just 
before the collision, and there is a guy in a circle in a casual walking 
stance, seemingly about to retrieve the man from his moped. When I shared 
my theory on the possibility of this being a technological phenomenon, 
there was a video posted shortly afterwards, dismissing the video as a 
hoax, and having been shot for some film or other. I'm not convinced. Then 
there's IBM's research into teleportation, which they declared to have been 
researching sometime back in the early 90s. IBM have also come under 
criticism for their involvement in the holocaust, which was subject to a 
documentary by a man called Edwin Black. I don't think that it is a 
coincidence that in the game Half-Life 2, there is a character called 
Wallace Breene that resembles Edwin Black, and is portrayed as an evil 
tyrant. It would also make sense that the creators of Half-Life 2, Valve 
Software, would also release the Portal series of games, where the player 
uses a teleportation gun to solve various puzzles. In an episode of Top 
Gear, Jeremy Clarkson talks about Lexuses. I can't remember the exact 
quote, but he associates Lexuses with golf and Freemasons. I think he uses 
the word "golf" as a euphemism for the use of technology at sites such as 
Menwith Hill (known locally as "The Golf Balls"), implying that The 
Freemasons are granted access to the secret technologies available there, 
for their own personal use, perhaps in exchange for money. There is an 
episode of The Simpsons where Homer is inducted into "The Stonecutters" as 
they believe that he is a figure that has been prophesised to be 
their leader. After a while, the Stonecutters get sick of Homer and set 
up a new secret society known as the "No Homers" club. I believe that  this 
outlines the different groups with their separate technology. Clearly 
"Homers" are not allowed to be "Stonecutters", and as such, Mr. Garrison, 
who is a "Homer", invents his own form of this technology.﻿

comments.author: Kaiuchka

comments.text:
I feel people can relate to the main character's struggles and pain, and 
you want to root for him. A chemistry teacher facing death and a midlife 
crisis is a very worthy character to support.

As he builds success, the show revolves around those schemes and drama. 
Ultimately he becomes an arrogant prick which is quite entertaining to 
watch where you are torn on whether to keep supporting him or wish for his 
downfall.

The acting, writing are good. 

It is a 5 season Scarface, with a twist.
